comments:
Description:
Cache function does not work properly when the sql statement contains parameter.

Steps to reproduce:
1.Create a sample datasource, create a dataset with sql statement:"select * from CLASSICMODELS.ORDERS where CLASSICMODELS.ORDERS.STATUS!=?". Set the parameter value as "a".
2.Set the cache preference, set the first 3 rows to report preview.
3.But preview in designer, return all the rows instead of 3 rows.

Expected result:
Return the row number of cache setting.

If i create a new report, this problem will not be reproduced.

Cancel.
Pull a chart to the layout too, preview in designer. Then the dataset will return all rows instead of 3 rows.
This issue has no relation with parameter.
This bug can not be reproduced.
It is a bug, please try it again.
It is a bug when parameter is used. Now fixed.

This bug is not resolved.
When just pull in a dataset to the layout, preview in designer the result is correct.
Then pull in a chart, bind with dataset, the dataset result returns all the columns instead of 3 row. There is also an error pop up:

????????????????:
- Chart ????????: 52
